column4: maybe I should run windows native, with linux under virtualbox - instead of the other way around :P

Made the move from windows to linux 18 months ago, after 2 months of excessive pain everything works... Then my install completely breaks, so I reinstall, and there are HEAPS of tiny agravating issues that nobody seems to be able to help with
it used to be that way for me too. if you are willing to work through the issues you will learn lots of good things
I tried, ALOT... I dunno, I figured you know what, maybe if I dist-upgrade things will likely be fixed (in fact I was sure of it), but then I get slapped in the face with KDE4 :P
oooh... yes, i am still using kde 3.5.10 and hardy for that reason
err not hardy but intrepid. maybe you can try that
*cries* - Would a dist-upgrade get me to Intrepid without bursting into flame?
I should I do a complete reinstall?
probably a clean reinstall would work best
you can get a list of things you have installed and reinstall them
w00t! thanks for that, downloading the interepid ISO now
you got your list of installed packages somewhere on home?
